intro: Hemicarpha aristulata, commonly known as the slender grassvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and marshes. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Hemicarpha aristulata is often found in wetland ecosystems and plays a role in soil stabilization and biodiversity.
